channel.title: NPR Topics: Business
channel.description: Find the latest business news with reports on Wall Street, interest rates, banking, companies, and U.S. and world financial markets. Subscribe to the Business Story of the Day podcast.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: A struggling lumber industry wants to join farmers in government bailout package
item.description: The U.S. hardwood lumber industry is struggling because of past tariffs and a recent export ban to China. Now the industry says, just like soybean farmers, they need help.
item.content:encoded: The U.S. hardwood lumber industry is struggling because of past tariffs and a recent export ban to China. Now the industry says, just like soybean farmers, they need help.
item.dc:creator: Justin Hicks

item.title: Recalled baby formula linked to a botulism outbreak may still be in some stores
item.description: A botulism outbreak that has sickened more than two dozen babies in 15 states has been linked to ByHeart formula sold nationwide. Here's what to know about it.
item.content:encoded:
A botulism outbreak that has sickened more than two dozen babies in 15 states has been linked to ByHeart formula sold nationwide. Here's what to know about it.

(Image credit: Cheyanne Mumphrey)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: Overdue jobs report shows employers added 119,000 jobs in September
item.description: U.S. employers added 119,000 jobs in September, while the unemployment rate inched up to 4.4%. The report, which was delayed by the government shutdown, may hint at the pace of hiring and firing.
item.content:encoded:
U.S. employers added 119,000 jobs in September, while the unemployment rate inched up to 4.4%. The report, which was delayed by the government shutdown, may hint at the pace of hiring and firing.

(Image credit: Frederic J. Brown)
item.dc:creator: Scott Horsley

item.title: Trump administration seeks to roll back protections for imperiled species and habitat
item.description: The Interior Department proposed reviving a suite of changes to Endangered Species Act regulations first made during the Republican's first term. Those changes were reversed under former President Biden.
item.content:encoded:
The Interior Department proposed reviving a suite of changes to Endangered Species Act regulations first made during the Republican's first term. Those changes were reversed under former President Biden.

(Image credit: Erin Hooley)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: The AI industry is booming. Is this massive bubble about to burst?
item.description: Is the trillion-dollar AI investment boom completely irrational? Google head Sundar Pichai thinks so, telling the BBC that there are "elements of irrationality" — yet Wall Street continues to invest.
item.content:encoded: Is the trillion-dollar AI investment boom completely irrational? Google head Sundar Pichai thinks so, telling the BBC that there are "elements of irrationality" — yet Wall Street continues to invest.
item.dc:creator: Maria Aspan

item.title: How a small Chicago nonprofit is resisting Trump's war on DEI
item.description: Since 1981, Chicago Women in Trades has worked to promote equity by getting more women into the construction trades. Now the nonprofit faces a different challenge: Trump's efforts to erase DEI.
item.content:encoded:
Since 1981, Chicago Women in Trades has worked to promote equity by getting more women into the construction trades. Now the nonprofit faces a different challenge: Trump's efforts to erase DEI.

(Image credit: Andrea Hsu)
item.dc:creator: Andrea Hsu

item.title: Meta beats FTC case, won't have to spin off WhatsApp, Instagram
item.description: A federal judge ruled against the Federal Trade Commission's antitrust suit alleging that Meta had stifled competition by buying up its rivals.
item.content:encoded: A federal judge ruled against the Federal Trade Commission's antitrust suit alleging that Meta had stifled competition by buying up its rivals.
item.dc:creator: Bobby Allyn

item.title: What does it take to work in the same job for decades?
item.description: NPR's Juana Summers speaks with Wall Street Journal reporter Chip Cutter, who recently spoke with a bunch of the longest-tenured employees at a range of companies, all in different fields.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Juana Summers speaks with Wall Street Journal reporter Chip Cutter, who recently spoke with a bunch of the longest-tenured employees at a range of companies, all in different fields.
item.dc:creator: Daniel Ofman

item.title: Warner Bros. Discovery is up for sale as theaters hope for a renewed focus on films
item.description: Warner Brothers Discovery is accepting bids this week, sparking concerns among theater owners who hope the potential buyer will prioritize making movies for cinemas.
item.content:encoded: Warner Brothers Discovery is accepting bids this week, sparking concerns among theater owners who hope the potential buyer will prioritize making movies for cinemas.
item.dc:creator: Mandalit del Barco

item.title: Judge sides with Meta in antitrust trial, will not spin off WhatsApp and Instagram
item.description: A federal judge ruled against the Federal Trade Commission's antitrust suit alleging that Meta had stifled competition by buying up its rivals.
item.content:encoded:
A federal judge ruled against the Federal Trade Commission's antitrust suit alleging that Meta had stifled competition by buying up its rivals.

(Image credit: Tony Avelar)
item.dc:creator: John Ruwitch
